ComicInfo.Summary:
Various short satires of pop culture.
Parody of President Bush's final State of the Union address, noting supposed highlights of his presidency.
The Black Spy fools the White Spy into thinking he can follow him into the air by filling helium ballons from a tank that is actually an H-bomb.
More stupid answers to stupid questions.
Unusual causes of death and things that can go wrong when you try to cheat death.
Parody of tv show, showing wilderness survival skills (mis)applied to a shopping mall.
Thoughts on what the presidential candidates would say if they had a few too many beers with you.
The Fantabulaman strip tells his origin, revealing his given name.
Stills from the tv show "Kid Nation" with fake dialogue.
Things that might happen if the obese used their weight and size to make life miserable for others.
Monroe's grandfather destroys everything in the house that was made in China, including Monroe's childhood toys, after hearing about a product recall.
ComicInfo.Tags: Monroe,Bear Grylls,Fantabulaman,Black Spy,White Spy,George W. Bush,Alfred E. Neuman

Spy; Snappy Answers To Stupid Questions; Sergio Aragonès Presents A Mad Look at Death; Drawn-Out Dramas; Man Vs.
